column2:
character
  1. The first letter of the Hunsrik alphabet, written in the Latin script.

noun
  1. (anatomy) rectum (terminal part of the large intestine)
  2. Dish made with beef or pork intestine stuffed with ground meat.

noun
  1. job (economic role for which a person is paid)

noun
  1. abacus (table with balls on wires or counters in groves, for counting)

pron
  1. Mr., mister, sir
  2. gentleman
  3. master, lord, generally denotes that somebody has control over something, either in a generic or in a regal sense
  4. Lord, God
  5. Used as a title of respect that is not translated into English or replaced with Sir

noun
  1. a Nazi (“member or (ideological) supporter of Nazism or neo-Nazism”)

noun
  1. hinge (device for the pivoting of a door)

name
  1. (biblical) Jacob (one of the sons of Isaac and Rebecca)

noun
  1. a type of jam made in Southern Brazil with juice and pulp from fruits
  2. sweat bread spread

noun
  1. maté (hot drink made from the Ilex paraguarensis plant)

noun
  1. time, time of day (time according to the clock)

verb
  1. to advance one another
  2. to attack each other
  3. to enter a fight
  4. to catch up

verb
  1. to try (taste of food, fit of clothing etc.)

verb
  1. to stay; to remain in a place

prep
  1. by means of; by; through
  2. through; entering, then exiting
  3. via

adv
  1. during; throughout; through
  2. past

verb
  1. to drive; to guide; to lead, to move on a course

verb
  1. (auxiliary, with an infinitive) will; to be going (to do something); forms the future tense
  2. (auxiliary, with an infinitive) to be; forms the progressive aspect
  3. to put, to place, to add

verb
  1. to miss (be late for; be unable to use or attend)

verb
  1. (of an animal) to eat; to feed on; to devour
  2. (of a person, derogatory) to stuff oneself; to gorge oneself; to eat like a pig
  3. (figuratively) to consume, to guzzle, to burn

verb
  1. to have
  2. (auxiliary, with a past participle) to have (forms the perfect)

verb
  1. to rap, to knock (on a door)
  2. to beat (a rug or person)

prep
  1. with (in the company of; alongside)
  2. with, by (using as an instrument; by means of)

adj
  1. Nazi (relating to Nazis, the Nazi party or Nazi Germany)

verb
  1. to count, to reckon, to calculate, to compute

verb
  1. (intransitive) to travel [auxiliary sin]
  2. (transitive) to tear (something); to pull (something) apart; to rip (something) [auxiliary hon]
  3. (intransitive) to break; to become torn apart [auxiliary sin]

verb
  1. to work, to labor
  2. to solve, to fix

det
  1. his
  2. its (agreeing with a neuter or masculine noun)

verb
  1. to see; to look; to have sight

verb
  1. to be
  2. (auxiliary) forms the perfect tense of most intransitive verbs

adv
  1. used with personal pronouns to form the reflexive; -self

verb
  1. (with dative) to serve (to work as a servant for someone)

verb
  1. to hit, to strike
  2. to meet, to encounter

abbrev
  1. uff + das, on the, onto the, up the
